name: Crim-Andromeda-Early Game Crush
description:
This deck is my take on the currently-popular Andromeda deck. It has classic elements, i.e. sporting the Anarch breaker sweet, 3x Account Siphon, among many other staples. I do the 2x Quality time and 1x Corroder, instead of the 2x corroder 3x special order as I find this to be most effective.

Where this differs is that I only sport 2 Desperado as a matter of lining up to the number I have in real life sets (1 e3 feedback implants are there instead of the third to splash against HB)

The most important change I have is the addition of 2 bankjobs to beat Marked Accounts/San San spamming/ Asset spamming economy decks that this Andy archetype seems to have trouble with otherwise. Also, the classic 2x Hostages are to tutor your Professional Contacts (always awesome), John Masanori (against Jinteki it's amazing), and Kati Jones. I include 2x Kati Jones because a fast advanced breaking news on a San San into trashing your Kati has ruined one too many games for me (bye bye economy engine), so I throw in a backup.

name: Bushido
description: Katsumoto: You have seen many things. Nathan Algren: I have. Katsumoto: And you do not fear death, but sometimes you wish for it. Is this not so? Nathan Algren: Yes. Katsumoto: I also. It happens to men who have seen what we have seen. But then I come to this place of my ancestors, and I remember. Like these blossoms, we are all dying. To know life in every breath, every cup of tea, every life we take. The way of the warrior.... Nathan Algren: Life in every breath... Katsumoto: That is Bushido.

name: Off to Build It!
description: Off the Grid deck that would be tons of times better with the other ID, but since I have to compete in a tournament that requires the usage of the most underestimated identities in the game. Anyway this has given me the chance and willpower to try this deck concept out. Great importance is given to upgrades: Red Herrings is not a mere trick, it's your main R&D defense, since it's a cheap "fire and forget" early game defense, that'll avoid you losing too much ground from a well placed or lucky maker's eye or interface, while Ruhr Valley makes running on HQ really time consuming and Corporate Troubleshooter allows you to buy time by denying a lethal HQ successful run. Early game, your main objective is to score a 5/3. Either will do, since PrioReq, will rez you an Hadrian's Wall on HQ for free, while The Cleaners will boost your Dedicated Response Team to 3, making any server in which the Team is installed a priority target. That's good: it keeps your remotes kinda "off the grid", since you'll have put some serious bling on HQ, and that's the server of choice for the Team. Snare! is my only doubt: it takes 4 influence that I could use in a more coherent way, splashing a Tollbooth or some other heavy guy, or adding Vipers due to their time-sucking function. I tried to balance ICE as much as possible, and am considering switching gates to 3 enigmas: even though they are weak, with Troubleshooter they are a potential agenda score on my off server. Summing up my doubts, I might go -2 Snare +2 Viper -2 Datapike +1 Enigma (And I'll make room to use the 2 influences). Comments welcome!

name: Spanish Inquisition v4
description:
Fourth revision of this deck.

Basically just a small update, everything about the previous revision still applies. This rev gets rid of a one particular weakness - tempo loss on djinn. So: -3 djinn +1 medium +1 nerve agent +1 datasucker -1 crescentus +1 akamatsu mem chip. It is better to simply draw into viruses than to lose time and cash on djinn. Singleton akamatsu makes sure I can play what I want in the late game (4MU is usually occupied by datasucker, medium, mimic and corroder by that time).

name: Spinal Kate 2.0 (Cyberfeeder edition)
description: took out spinal modems and replaced them with feeders, added a 3rd hostage and datasucker. +3 AMC, got rid of kati jones which never gets installed

name: Not so cuddly now
description: A Weyland deck which probably overcompensates for the fact that normal Weyland has no real defences by throwing in a tonne of NBN tagging stuff.

name: Jinteki wants to play a game with you
description:
looking forward Honor & profit and cards like caprice nisei, here is the beta RP I'm thinking about till some weeks.

A funny deck to play with the ice + midori supported by Corporate Troubleshooter and interns.

Economy: sundew, Melange. If you protect them, you will have enought money to advance and play with ice.
